snippet: After retrieving a laptop in a strike on a Qaeda leader, American and Afghan commandos increased secret night raids on militants, even as the U.S. has declared the Afghanistan war essentially over.
abstract: Intelligence trove from laptop captured in October 2014 raid in Afghanistan has helped fuel a significant increase in nighttime operations by American special forces and Afghan commandos; uptick is at odds with Obama administration's policy assertion that war in Afghanistan has come to an official end, but reflects cold reality of increasing violence in nation that has killed record number of Afghan soldiers, police officers and civilians.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: After retrieving a laptop in a strike on a Qaeda leader, American and Afghan commandos increased secret night raids on militants, even as the U.S. has declared the Afghanistan war essentially over.

headline.seo: Data From Seized Computer Fuels a Surge in U.S. Raids on Al Qaeda
headline.main: U.S. Is Escalating a Secretive War in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Escalating a Secretive War in Afghanistan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
